Company: Office of the State Superintendent of Education D.C.
Description of incident: The D.C. agency that handles college            financial aid requests had accidentally e-mailed personal information            from 2,400 student applicants to more than 1,000 of those applicants.            An employee of the agency's Higher Education Financial Services Program            inadvertently attached an Excel spreadsheet to an e-mail. The information            included student names, e-mail and home addresses, phone and Social            Security numbers and dates of birth.
